messages.message:
there’s a problematic Converse project that can’t be deleted - `01901359-7486-7014-81b3-0f38cd596a7e` -> this is causing `view-my-hub` to fail sometimes and `converse-project-crud` to fail sometimes
• https://cloud.cypress.io/projects/cfhedy/runs/11293 on @Udit’s PR
• https://cloud.cypress.io/projects/cfhedy/runs/11292 on @Xindi Xu’s PR
we get a `Could not read project` error from `GetDataDrivePath` in `core-platform-service` - any thoughts on why this would occur? any recent db changes maybe?
cc @mfichman @Jeff in case this could be related to the db migrations from earlier this week
I just checked the SQL query. The query does not select any entries from the repos table to which the db migration failure relates.

the error is being returned on this line https://github.com/instabase/instabase/blob/3a9e9ca/core-services/core-platform-se[…]rvice/src/go/src/instabase/coreplatformservice/aihub/handler.go (https://github.com/instabase/instabase/blob/3a9e9ca/core-services/core-platform-service/src/go/src/instabase/coreplatformservice/aihub/handler.go#L946)

is there any way to see what error the db returned?

i logged in as <mailto:support-testing+1@instabase.com|support-testing+1@instabase.com> and was somehow able to delete this Converse project :confused_dog:

so i guess we should be good??
The GetModel function fails usually because the row does not exist. I try to select this project from the database directly and it seems like it does not exist.

The err returned from db is discarded. I think code could be improved by returning the error message from db.
https://github.com/instabase/instabase/blob/3a9e9ca/core-services/core-platform-se[…]rvice/src/go/src/instabase/coreplatformservice/aihub/handler.go (https://github.com/instabase/instabase/blob/3a9e9ca/core-services/core-platform-service/src/go/src/instabase/coreplatformservice/aihub/handler.go#L944C11-L944C14)
If there was a true error (not the not-found case) then the DB layer would log it
To see if the error exists, you can search Loki for that trace id. It will turn up any log messages related to the trace.
